ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Querystring question
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I ve used 404 myself, but I could think of good reasons not to. If there was some set of query params that identified the primary key for the resource,

On Mon, Feb 24, 2003 at 10:44:40AM -0500, Seairth Jacobs wrote:
> If "mortal" isn't recognized at all, then what?  It seems to me that 404 is
> the correct response, but I wanted to make sure...

I've used 404 myself, but I could think of good reasons not to.

If there was some set of query params that identified the "primary
key" for the resource, then additional parameters could safely be
ignored such that GET returned the same representations as for the
URI with only the primary key params specified.  In theory, it may be
useful to return a 302 response back to this primary URI; in practice,
it's certainly not worth the extra round trip, so probably fine to
just return the same representations on a 200 until new parameters
are supported.

If you expect your primary key may change, then a 404 approach
probably makes good sense.

That's just my first thoughts on the subject.  It's a pretty
interesting question though; a real mental-model stress test.

MB
